author: racytech
content: Imho I don't think messages are important, we can report numbers instead of messages and this still be a valid. what I think does matter is the order of errors, in the context of container validation

author: _shemnon
content: Fixing an order of errors could preclude certain optiimzations, such as parallel section validation.  One section could have an invalid opcode while a second could have invalid stack validaion, an efficient algo would bail at the first detected opcode, and requireing them to report the first error in the firs section encodes into the protocol iniefficincy.  The only thing consensus requires is an assertion that it is valid or invalid, no why.

content: This makes sense, wasn't looking at it from parallel section validation agnle
